result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara J. Gapp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sara J. Gapp not in court. Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Sara J. Gapp.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant not able to appear due to medical issues. Attorney Hagerman to provide proof or warrant will issue at next court date. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sara J. Gapp not in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Sara J. Gapp. Defendant is to be booked and printed by the end of the week. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sara J. Gapp not in court - authorization filed.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for defendant. Called @ 11:03 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearances on both files - 22CM299 and 22CT254. Record by Atty. Hagerman who enters not guilty pleas as to all charges and requests status in about 45 days. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sara J. Gapp not in court. Attorney Hagerman for defendant. Warrant to issue, stayed until July 5th. Defendant has health issues. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
